channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report E-2023110034
item.description:
Report E-2023110034

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 19, 2023, ten (10) 5-gallon bladders of UN3267 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately seven (7) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel neutralized and collected the released product with citric acid, and they repeated this process until no corrosive liquid remained and the surface had a neutral pH. Crews cut-up the impacted pallet with hand tools. All neutralized product, the cut-up pallet, the ten (10) damaged bladders, and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon poly drums that were staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.title: Report X-2023100239
item.description:
Report X-2023100239

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-25
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Haz Mat was brought over to QA area with sounds of broken glass. Container was then opened after putting on gloves to investigate. Item placed into a container to contain package by a certified admin DescribePack: Side walls of glass jar broke sometime during transit and leaked all contents of package DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Certified admin ensured gloves were put on to decrease skin exposure to any remaining liquid. before placing into a secured drum.

item.title: Report X-2023090114
item.description:
Report X-2023090114

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-04T06:23:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-04
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The forklift operator was attempting to load the skid of UN2922 onto the trailer when the forklift blade punctured the bottom of the drum, ~causing the spill on the dock and in the trailer.
